explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition (EO9.5).

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition (EO9.5).

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition (EO9.5).

flammable_liquids.rationale: The flash point is 282degC (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment (2004)) (EO9.5).

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition (EO9.5).

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Considered non-pyrophoric when in contact with air at ordinary temperatures since the substance is used as commercial detergents (EO9.5, CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment (2004))

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition (EO9.5).

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test method applicable to liquid substances are not available (test temperature: 140degC).

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not fluorine and chlorine), with oxygen bound to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements)

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition (EO9.5).

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: The test compounds with different EO chain lengths yielded substantially different toxic effect values: 1,300mg/kg (EO10), >15,900mg/kg (EO20) (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.96 (2004)).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: The test compounds with different EO chain lengths yielded substantially different toxic effect values: 1,800mg/kg (EO7), >10,000mg/kg (EO40) (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.96 (2004)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is a liquid according to the GHS criteria and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit skin irritation tests (exposure duration unknown) (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.96 (2004)): Application of the undiluted test compound (EO2-9) produced "moderate to severe irritation" of the skin.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit eye irritation tests (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.96 (2004)): Instillation of the undiluted test compound (EO2-15) resulted in "moderate to severe irritation" of the eye. The substance is thus considered "strongly irritating."

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: According to the description in CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.96 (2004), a skin sensitization study with the test compound (EO6) showed no indication of sensitization in guinea pigs. However, classification is not possible due to lack of sufficient data because only one set of data showing "negative" is available.

carcinogenicity.rationale: Based on negative data in multi-generation mutagenicity tests (dominant lethal tests) and somatic cell mutagenicity tests in vivo (micronucleus tests), and the absence of data in in vivo germ cell mutagenicity tests, described in CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.96 (2004) and NITE Initial Risk Assessment No.96 (2005).

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: Classification not possible based on a judgment made by experts in the absence of existing classification, though CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.96 (2004) and NITE Initial Risk Assessment No.96 (2005) present some toxicity data.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: Suspected of damaging fertility or the unborn child
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence of reduced female fertility and a decreased number of embryos, described in CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.96 (2004) and NITE Initial Risk Assessment No.96 (2005) (though no data are available regarding parental toxicity).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Classification not possible due to the insufficiency of data.

aspiration_hazard.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
aspiration_hazard.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (liver, cardiovascular system)
aspiration_hazard.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including "an increase in relative liver weights in females; histopathological examination revealed hepatocellular fatty changes in both sexes," "microscopic examination showed focal necrosis of myocardium" (NITE Initial Risk Assessment No.96 (2005)). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.

acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life (NPE1.5, NPE9-10)
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: NPE1.5: It was classified into Category 1 from 48 hours LC50=0.11mg/L of the crustacea (Mysid Shrimp) (CERI/NITE Hazard Assessment Report (2005)). NPE9-10: It was classified into Category 1 from 96 hours LC50=1.0mg/L of the fish (Salmo trutta) (CERI/NITE Hazard Assessment Report (2005)). NPE30: It was classified into Not classified from 96 hours LC50>1000mg/L of the fish (Bluegill) (CERI/NITE Hazard Assessment Report (2005)). [NOTE] Since the toxicity of polyoxyethylene nonylphenyl ether increases as ethylene oxide chain length decreases, it pointed to the category of several ethylene oxide chain length. In addition, polyoxyethylene nonylphenyl ether described as NPEn (n: mole numbers of added ethylene oxide.).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.classification: Classification not possible (NPE1.5, NPE9-10), Not classified (NPE30)
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: NPE1.5, NPE9-10: Since degradability and bioaccumulation depend on mole numbers of added ethylene oxide and test condition and there was no data about each chain length, classification is not possible. NP30: Since it was not poorly water-soluble (the water solubility increases as mole numbers of ethylene oxide increase, and it can be soluble in the water if mole numbers become more than 7 (CERI/NITE Hazard Assessment Report (2005))), and acute toxicity was low, it was classified into Not classified. [NOTE] Since the toxicity of polyoxyethylene nonylphenyl ether increases as ethylene oxide chain length decreases, it pointed to the category of several ethylene oxide chain length. In addition, polyoxyethylene nonylphenyl ether described as NPEn (n: mole numbers of added ethylene oxide.).
